sect2.title: Typed Filters
sect2.para: A structure in Wolframe is described as serialization of it's equivalent as tree (more precisely forest) with depht first left order traversal. The equivalent of a tree is a tree with leaf nodes representing the atomic values of the structure and non leaf nodes representing sub structures labeled by the non leaf node value. The serialization is a sequence of (element type, element value) tuples with 3 origin element types for describing such a structure. For having a model that is able to cover at least XML there is a 4th element 'Attribute'.

row.entry: Opens a sub node (node label = element value)
Closes the currently open sub node (no node value)
Atomic value (leaf node, value = element value)
For rewriting origin sequences of (Open,Value,Close) as (Attribute,Value) under the precondition that they follow an 'Open' element or an element rewritten as (Attribute,Value) tuple.

sect2.para: Element values are typed (represented as union of atomic types: bool,uint,int,double,string, etc.. ).
